title: Twisted sex-obsessed serial rapist stashed handcuffs and ball-gag at his home
text:

A sex obsessed rapist was branded a danger to women until only old age or infirmity made it impossible to hurt them.

That was a judge's view of David Bowes, described as a perverted fantasist with a “desire to control and hurt”.

He came before the courts for the rape of a prostitute in Middlesbrough in 2007, at which time it emerged he had a history of brutal sex attacks

TeessideLive has been looking back at historic crime events that shock their local community, including the horrific attacks by Bowes.

(Image: Gazette Live WS)

Aged 55 at the time of the 2007 crime, he often frequented Teesside's red light districts.

It was there he picked up his victim on New Year's Day and after taking her back to his bungalow in Stockon, Bowes began attacking her.

And as the petrified woman bit into his thumb to the bone in a desperate attempt to escape, he gouged her right eye.

After a 15-minute violent struggle, the exhausted woman eventually submitted and he tied her hands and feet before raping her in his living room.

Bowes was arrested hours later at his home, where police found three sets of handcuffs, a ball gag and a chain with padlocks.

He denied the charges, forcing his victim to take the stand at Teesside Crown Court and recount her terrifying ordeal.

She said he seemed a simple soul - nice, slow, even “dumb” - when he picked her up in Middlesbrough. And she had no idea of the nightmare she was about to face in his bungalow.

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)

“I felt sorry for him,” she said of the man who called himself Fred.

He turned nasty as he massaged her shoulders after a consensual sex act.

Bowes produced handcuffs, cuffed her right wrist and tried to strangle her with a ball gag, said the woman.

While fighting to escape, terrible thoughts rushed through her mind - the thought of being buried on the Moors and the murder of Middlesbrough girl Vicky Glass.

She even feared she was being attacked by the then hunted killer of the Ipswich vice girls.

“I was just thinking he was the b*****d who killed the Ipswich girls who went missing and were found, but they had not found the bloke,” she said.

“I thought I was going to die in that house. I was deliberately leaving DNA all over the place."

Bowes claimed the woman was lying. But after less than two hours of deliberation, the jury found him guilty of rape and false imprisonment.

It then came to light that Bowes had been a dangerous sexual predator from a young age.

In 1968, when he was just 16, he followed a girl of the same age, stabbed her in the back, indecently assaulted her and ran off with her bag.

Then in 1970, he followed and attempted to choke, suffocate or strangle a 21-year-old woman.

And in 1981, he was convicted of raping a mum-of-two he lured to the boiler room of an Essex swimming baths, tying her hands and gagging her.

Following that conviction he was detained in Rampton - home to some of the country's most dangerous prisoners - before eventually being released from St Luke's Hospital in Middlesbrough.

He enrolled on a Teesside University course in IT but his twisted nature eventually reared its ugly head again.

There was no clear evidence of a psychotic disorder, the court had heard, but his crimes might have come from Bowes’ life “unravelling”, along with sexual failings and frustration.

Prosecutor David Brooke had told the jury: "Somewhere deep in this man’s mind, from a young age, is clearly some sort of perverse desire to control, to hurt.”

Bowes had been employed as an electrician around the time of the attack, working in the homes of vulnerable single mums.

In his police interview, Bowes said: "It’s to do with control. I had the control. I put the handcuffs on, I’m the one who takes them off.”

Speaking after Bowes was sentenced, his brave victim spoke out and said almost all of the girls she knew working on the streets had been attacked - but next to none reported the crimes.

She sent a message to other sex workers, urging them to stand up against men like Bowes.

"It doesn’t matter if you’re a prostitute or not. I’m living proof that you can be believed," she said.
description: David Bowes, 55, had recently fathered a child when he raped his final victim after luring his victim to his bungalow in Middlesborough
